Article.ArticleTitle: Precise Layer Control of MoTe<sub>2</sub> by Ozone Treatment.

AbstractText: Transition metal dichalcogenides (TMDCs) demonstrate great potential in numerous applications. However, these applications require a precise control of layer thickness at the atomic scale. In this work, we present an in-situ study of the self-limiting oxidation process in MoTe<sub>2</sub> by ozone (O<sub>3</sub>) treatment. A precise layer-by-layer control of MoTe<sub>2</sub> flakes can be achieved via multiple cycles of oxidation and wet etching. The thinned MoTe<sub>2</sub> flakes exhibit comparable optical properties and film quality to the pristine exfoliated ones. Besides, an additional p-type doping is observed after O<sub>3</sub> oxidation. Such a p-doping effect converts the device properties of MoTe<sub>2</sub> from electron-dominated to hole-dominated ambipolar characteristics.
